item.description:
The Santanoni Range:

Couchsachraga Peak, Panther Peak, Santanoni Peak.


HIKE IT!


PLEASE -- REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. **NOTE: THIS WEEKEND'S EVENTS ARE HIGHLY WEATHER / TRAIL-CONDITION DEPENDENT.**


EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT).  Email me with your thoughts about this trip ... you can text me to the above number as well. WORK TOWARD YOUR WINTER ADK LIST WITH US!


The Trifecta!  We'll do Coochie first from Times Square ... then Panther, and Santanoni Peak last.

 
A view from Panther Peak of Santanoni Peak, the prize ascent of the day!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

Lodging:  This is a weekend trip in conjunction with a hike from the Elk Lake trailhead to Macomb Mountain, South Dix (Carson Peak) and East Dix (Grace Peak).  We have $50 / room rates for a limited number at the Yellow Coach in Schroon Lake (Exit 27) right across the street from the Stewart's Shop (opens @ 5 a.m.) and Flanagan's Pub and Grill.  Please sign up early so we can get this deal!

 

Difficulty -- STOP, READ!

(a) Couchsachraga Peak, returning back off the range from Times Square: 13.8 miles RT, about 4,230' ASL (RT) vertical climbing;

(b) Panther Peak and Santanoni Peak, walking to Panther Peak to the north, then south to Santanoni Peak, and back down to the DEC trail: 14.2 miles RT, about 3,209' ASL (RT) vertical climbing;

(c) All three peaks, about 17.0 miles RT, about 4,699' vertical climbing; at 1.25 miles / hour, this is about a 13.5-hour hike.


Google Maps:  Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from Salem NH to the motel in Schroon Lake, NY; then to the trailhead (I-87 / Northway Exit 29, Upper Works Road, Tahawus, NY):

Longest Estimated Drive Time From Meetup: 4 hour, 56 minutes; est. distance: 228 miles ONE WAY.


A view from the Panther Peak summit

 

UPDATES (12/28/2011 12:30 p.m.) -- STOP, READ!

Have you ever thought about hiking in the Adirondacks?  They are starkly different than any other mountains in the Northeast.  As relatively new mountains -- the result of an odd and unexplained hot spot under the earth's crust that continue to heave up dense anorthosite and other Canadian "basement" rocks -- they appear "Alp-like" in scale and character as you climb them.   More typically these hikes involve a long, gradual ascent into the back county -- and then you hit a wall and the final 1-2 miles to the summit ... and the glorious views of the Adirondack High Peaks!

  • The Google link in the calendar post provides directions from the Park & Ride lot, New Paltz, NY, to the Santanoni Road parking lot. IMPORTANT: This lot is on the left, just before the end of CR 25 (where the larger Upper Works parking lot is located). If you've passed the Mt. Adams / Allen Mountain parking area (on the right), or reach the end of CR 25, you've driven too far.
  • Please note that if you plan to spend the night in Schroon Lake or Long Lake, you will need at least one hour's drive time to reach the trailhead.
  • We'll head to "Times Square" from Upper Works and head for (a) Couchsachraga Peak first, returning back off the range from Times Square; then to (b) Panther Peak, then (c) south to Santanoni Peak. (d) We may or may not descend back to the DEC trail via the "New Old Trail" herd path -- it's a very long, steep route that may be unbroken and socked in with snow.  If that's the case we'll return to Times Square and descend, which adds about 1.5 miles to this trip.
  • Weather/ trail updates will be added here, beginning a week prior to the event. Past Bradley Pond, all the trails are herd paths that are very tight in spots -- be extra careful to look for spruce traps in deep snow.
  • Please, if you have a GPS, add a track from a previous hiker's trip to your device. Right-Click / Download a GPX track for Coochie and Santanoni HERE!
  • This is a real challenge, my toughest ADK trip! In the summer this trip has taken me nearly 12 hours to complete, and the winter trip will take longer. Be sure to view and print out the trip planner and topo maps from the calendar post.  If any of you have any other suggestions, email me and let me know.

 

ESSENTIALS TO BRING:  Flash light AND head lamp / extra batteries, food / (extra) snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; bring charcoal warmers for fingers and toes. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.  Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for these items; be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!  TEST YOUR LIGHTS!!! BRING EXTRA BATTERIES!!!


NOTE: Poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes and crampons are ESSENTIAL as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Snow shoes will likely be required -- stay tuned for weather updates.

CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR NEW YORK STATE.


ESSENTIAL RESEARCH WEB LINKS:

Santanoni Range Overview:
LINK: AdirondackJourney.com
LINK: Andrew Lavigne's Winter Trip Report (thanks for the photo and the details Andrew!!!)

Couchsachraga Peak:
LINK: Andrew Lavigne
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: PeakBagger

Panther Peak:
LINK: Andrew Lavigne
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: PeakBagger

Santanoni Peak:
LINK: Andrew Lavigne
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: PeakBagger


LINKS TO TOPO MAPS (view / print / take with you):

  • Trailhead on Upper Works Road
  • Route to Bradley Pond and up to the "Times Square" notch.
  • The route across the three peaks. Not shown is the "New Old Trail" that departs down to the east along the ridgeline from the first of the three Santanoni summit bumps.
  • Diagram of "Times Square.


TRIP PLANNER (view / print / take with you)


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

As Jim Wallace says ... Suck it up, get 'er done!

See you there!  Julie.

 

 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
